basics.name: Justin Honda
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science with an emphasis in bioinformatis in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I hope to graduate in Spring 2021 then matriculate into the M.S program.

volunteer.summary: Taught 5th grade students algebra 1, oversaw project SPF (see projects for more details), helped to raise funds for a shade structure
highlights: Taught basic algebra skills to elementary school students
Taught and facilitated the use of CAD to design and build 3D printed shade structure models
Facilitated the raising of funds needed to build a permanent structure implemented into an East Oahu elementary school campus through various fundraisers
Raised awareness of skin cancer and the necessity of SPF (sun protection)
Played an early role in the administrative processess of incorporation
Learned required technical skills to operate optical machinery for diagnostic and clinical purposes
Worked on the front-end administrative operations of patient care
Shadowed a board-certified ophthalmologist and witnessed hands on patient care and diagnosis
Reviewed case and clinical research studies under the supervision of a board-certified Opthalmologist.

awards.title: Speaker
awards.summary: Presented a clinical study of post-operative necrotizing scleritis. (See projects for more information)

awards.title: Magna Cum Laude
awards.summary: Awarded to high school seniors with a cumulative GPA of 3.80 or higher.
